DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the project is to investigate the effects of advanced glycation end products (AGEs) formed in food during the cooking process as well as AGEs formed naturally in the human body, on insulin sensitivity and risk factors for type 2 diabetes. The hypothesis is that i) food content of AGEs is lower using boiling and steaming cooking methods and that ii) AGEs formation in the body is lower at low dietary intake of certain sugar forms.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Food Cooking on Diabetes-2 Risk Factors
DOC.criteria: women, healthy between 20 and 50 y BMI between 25 and 40 kg/m2 weight circumference over 88 cm weigh changes within the last 2 months more than +/ 3 kg Physical activity more than 8 h per week smoking medications and supplements being vegetarian or vegan pregnancy or breast feeding postmenopause chronic disease previous gastric bypass surgery blood donation within the last 3 months Involvement in other clinical trials allergic to paraaminobenzoic acid
